stories.title: Database Schema for News Articles
stories.description: As a developer, I want a database schema to store news articles so that I can manage and retrieve fan club news.
acceptance_criteria: Database table 'news_articles' created with columns: id (PK), title (VARCHAR), content (TEXT), published_at (TIMESTAMP), author (VARCHAR).

stories.title: Database Schema for Game Schedules
stories.description: As a developer, I want a database schema to store game schedules so that I can display upcoming and past game information.
acceptance_criteria: Database table 'game_schedules' created with columns: id (PK), opponent (VARCHAR), date (DATE), time (TIME), location (VARCHAR), result (VARCHAR, nullable).

stories.title: Database Schema for Team Stats
stories.description: As a developer, I want a database schema to store team statistics so that I can present key performance indicators.
acceptance_criteria: Database table 'team_stats' created with columns: id (PK), season (VARCHAR), wins (INT), losses (INT), ties (INT), points_for (INT), points_against (INT).

stories.title: API Endpoint for Fetching News Articles
stories.description: As a backend developer, I want an API endpoint to fetch all news articles so that the frontend can display them.
acceptance_criteria: Endpoint returns a JSON array of news articles.

stories.title: API Endpoint for Fetching Specific News Article
stories.description: As a backend developer, I want an API endpoint to fetch a single news article by its ID so that the frontend can display article details.
acceptance_criteria: Endpoint returns a JSON object for the specified news article.

stories.title: API Endpoint for Fetching Game Schedules
stories.description: As a backend developer, I want an API endpoint to fetch all game schedules so that the frontend can display upcoming and past games.
acceptance_criteria: Endpoint returns a JSON array of game schedules.

stories.title: API Endpoint for Fetching Latest Team Stats
stories.description: As a backend developer, I want an API endpoint to fetch the latest team statistics so that the frontend can display current season performance.
acceptance_criteria: Endpoint returns a JSON object for the most recent season's team stats.

stories.title: Basic HTML Structure for Homepage
stories.description: As a frontend developer, I want a basic HTML structure for the homepage so that I can start building the user interface.
acceptance_criteria: HTML file 'index.html' created with basic boilerplate (DOCTYPE, html, head, body).

stories.title: Navigation Menu Component
stories.description: As a frontend developer, I want a reusable navigation menu component so that users can easily navigate between sections.
acceptance_criteria: Navigation menu component created with links for Home, News, Schedule, Team Stats, and Community.

stories.title: Homepage Layout with Placeholder Sections
stories.description: As a frontend developer, I want a homepage layout with placeholder sections for news, schedule, and stats so that I can visualize the content structure.
acceptance_criteria: Homepage displays distinct sections for 'Latest News', 'Upcoming Games', and 'Season Stats'.
Each section has a heading and placeholder content.

stories.title: News Articles List Component
stories.description: As a frontend developer, I want a component to display a list of news articles so that users can see recent updates.
acceptance_criteria: Component displays news articles with titles and publication dates.
Each article title is a link.

stories.title: Single News Article View Component
stories.description: As a frontend developer, I want a component to display the full content of a single news article so that users can read articles in detail.
acceptance_criteria: Component displays the title, author, publication date, and content of a news article.

stories.title: Game Schedule List Component
stories.description: As a frontend developer, I want a component to display the game schedule so that users can see upcoming and past games.
acceptance_criteria: Component displays games with opponent, date, time, and location.
Results are displayed for past games.

stories.title: Team Stats Display Component
stories.description: As a frontend developer, I want a component to display team statistics so that users can track the team's performance.
acceptance_criteria: Component displays season, wins, losses, ties, points for, and points against.

stories.title: Responsive Design for Header and Navigation
stories.description: As a frontend developer, I want the header and navigation to be responsive so that they adapt to different screen sizes.
acceptance_criteria: Header and navigation collapse into a hamburger menu on smaller screens.

stories.title: Responsive Design for Content Sections
stories.description: As a frontend developer, I want content sections (news, schedule, stats) to be responsive so that they display well on all devices.
acceptance_criteria: Content sections adjust their layout (e.g., columns stack) on smaller screens.

stories.title: Integrate API to Fetch and Display News
stories.description: As a frontend developer, I want to integrate the news API to fetch and display real news articles so that the website is populated with live content.
acceptance_criteria: Homepage displays actual news articles fetched from '/api/news'.
Clicking a news title navigates to a detailed view with content fetched from '/api/news/{id}'.

stories.title: Integrate API to Fetch and Display Game Schedule
stories.description: As a frontend developer, I want to integrate the game schedule API to fetch and display actual game data so that users see the real schedule.
acceptance_criteria: Homepage displays actual game schedules fetched from '/api/schedule'.

stories.title: Integrate API to Fetch and Display Team Stats
stories.description: As a frontend developer, I want to integrate the team stats API to fetch and display actual team statistics so that users see current season performance.
acceptance_criteria: Homepage displays actual team stats fetched from '/api/stats/latest'.

stories.title: Add Placeholder for Community Section
stories.description: As a frontend developer, I want a placeholder for the community section so that it's visible in the navigation and on the homepage.
acceptance_criteria: A dedicated 'Community' page or section is accessible via navigation.

stories.title: Basic Footer with Copyright
stories.description: As a frontend developer, I want a basic footer with a copyright notice so that the website has standard footer information.
acceptance_criteria: Footer contains a copyright notice (e.g., 'Â© 2023 Chicago Bears Fan Club').

stories.title: Styling for News Article Titles
stories.description: As a frontend developer, I want styled news article titles so that they are visually appealing and clickable.
acceptance_criteria: News article titles have a distinct font size, color, and underline on hover.

stories.title: Styling for Game Schedule Entries
stories.description: As a frontend developer, I want styled game schedule entries so that they are easy to read and understand.
acceptance_criteria: Each game entry has clear spacing and readable text for opponent, date, time, and location.

stories.title: Styling for Team Stats Table
stories.description: As a frontend developer, I want styled team stats to present them clearly, perhaps in a table.
acceptance_criteria: Team stats are presented in a clean, readable format (e.g., a table or key-value pairs).

stories.title: Add Basic Loading Indicators
stories.description: As a user, I want to see loading indicators when data is being fetched so that I know the application is working.
acceptance_criteria: A simple loading spinner or text is displayed while fetching data from APIs.
Loading indicator disappears once data is loaded.

stories.title: Error Handling for API Calls
stories.description: As a user, I want to see an informative message if there's an error fetching data so that I understand what went wrong.
acceptance_criteria: If an API call fails, a user-friendly error message is displayed (e.g., 'Could not load news. Please try again later.').

stories.title: Database Seed Data for News
stories.description: As a developer, I want to seed the database with initial news articles so that the website has content to display from the start.
acceptance_criteria: Database contains at least 3 sample news articles.

stories.title: Database Seed Data for Schedule
stories.description: As a developer, I want to seed the database with initial game schedules so that the website has schedule data to display.
acceptance_criteria: Database contains at least 3 sample game schedules (mix of past and future).

stories.title: Database Seed Data for Stats
stories.description: As a developer, I want to seed the database with initial team stats so that the website has stats data to display.
acceptance_criteria: Database contains at least 1 sample team stats entry for a recent season.

stories.title: Basic Image Handling for News Articles
stories.description: As a backend developer, I want to support storing image URLs for news articles so that the frontend can display images.
acceptance_criteria: The 'news_articles' table includes an 'image_url' column (VARCHAR, nullable).
API endpoints for news articles return the 'image_url'.

stories.title: Display Images in News List
stories.description: As a frontend developer, I want to display images alongside news article titles in the list so that the news section is more visually engaging.
acceptance_criteria: News list component displays a small thumbnail image for each article.

stories.title: Display Featured Image in Single Article View
stories.description: As a frontend developer, I want to display the main image prominently in the single news article view so that the content is visually rich.
acceptance_criteria: Single news article view displays a large featured image at the top.

stories.title: Basic Video Embedding for News Articles
stories.description: As a backend developer, I want to support storing video embed URLs for news articles so that the frontend can display embedded videos.
acceptance_criteria: The 'news_articles' table includes a 'video_embed_url' column (VARCHAR, nullable).
API endpoints for news articles return the 'video_embed_url'.

stories.title: Embed Video in Single Article View
stories.description: As a frontend developer, I want to embed videos in the single news article view when a URL is present so that users can watch embedded content.
acceptance_criteria: If 'video_embed_url' is present, an iframe embedding the video is displayed in the single article view.

non_goals: Complex animations or interactive elements beyond basic responsiveness.
description: Build a responsive web application for Chicago Bears fans to consume news, schedules, and team statistics.
